cheatsheet.title: Copying files between the local machine and the grid

intro.description:
Sometimes you have prepared files containing data on your local machine which should be processed by a job running on the grid.
Additionally, jobs can produce results in files which you would want to have on your local machine.
In this cheat sheet you will learn how to copy files between your local machine and the grid.

item.title: Open the "Grid Exploring" Perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the "Grid Exploring" Perspective, from the main menu, select Window > Open Perspective > Grid Exploring or click on the "Click to Perform" link.

item.title: Open the "Grid Projects" view
item.description: From menu select Window -> Show View -> Other -> g-Eclipse -> Grid Projects

subitem.label: Find left "Connections" view and on its toolbar click "New connection".
Enter the connection name (e.g. "localhost") and press "Next".

Select scheme "file" and enter local directory, to which you want to connect to (e.g. "C:\"). If you want to find subfolder on folders tree, click on link "create a temporary connection" and select desired folder. Press "Finish".

item.title: Create connection to Storage on the Grid

subitem.label: Go to the "Grid Project" view, expand the Virtual Organization in your project (blue icon), and expand "Storage".
Select any storage element. From the context menu choose "Mount".
Note that a new connection has appeared in the "Filesystems" folder in your Grid Project and in the "Connections" view.

item.title: Copying files
item.description:
As you now have local and grid connections, you can explore these storage areas and copy files between them using Drag&Drop.
The best way to do it is to open your local and grid connections in two separate "Connections" views.

subitem.label: In the left "Connections" view, find the destination directory to which you want to copy files.
On the right "Connections" view explore the source connection and select files which you want to copy.
Drag the selected files, move to the directory you found previously, and drop it there.
